skill.name: torch-geometric
skill.description: Graph Neural Networks (PyG). Node/graph classification, link prediction, GCN, GAT, GraphSAGE, heterogeneous graphs, molecular property prediction, for geometric deep learning.
skill.summary: Graph Neural Networks (PyG). Node/graph classification, link prediction, GCN, GAT, GraphSAGE, hetero...
skill.author: K-Dense Inc.

security_audit.summary: No credential access, environment harvesting, or exfiltration patterns detected. Scripts focus on model templates, benchmarking, and visualization without network or subprocess execution.

content.user_title: Build GNN workflows with PyTorch Geometric
content.value_statement: You need clear templates and references for graph learning tasks. This skill provides PyG model templates, benchmarks, and visualization helpers.
actual_capabilities: Generate node classification templates for GCN, GAT, and GraphSAGE
Generate a graph classification template for GIN
Benchmark GCN, GAT, and GraphSAGE on Planetoid or TUDataset datasets
Visualize graph structure with node colors, layouts, and labels
Plot degree distributions and graph statistics summaries
limitations: Requires PyTorch Geometric and its dependencies to be installed
Downloads datasets at runtime to /tmp when using example scripts
Supports only a small set of predefined model templates
No automated hyperparameter search or experiment tracking

use_cases.title: Benchmark GNN baselines
use_cases.description: Compare GCN, GAT, and GraphSAGE accuracy and training time on standard datasets.

use_cases.title: Start a graph project
use_cases.description: Generate a ready-to-train template for node or graph classification tasks.

use_cases.title: Teach graph concepts
use_cases.description: Visualize graph structure and degree distributions for classroom demos.

prompt_templates.title: Create a GCN starter
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a GCN node classification template and list the steps to run it on Cora.

prompt_templates.title: Run a benchmark
prompt_templates.prompt: Benchmark GCN and GAT on CiteSeer for 100 epochs and summarize the expected outputs.

prompt_templates.title: Visualize a dataset
prompt_templates.prompt: Show how to visualize the Cora graph with node colors by label and save to PNG.

prompt_templates.title: Plan a GIN run
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a GIN graph classification template and explain how to split ENZYMES into train and test.

output_examples.input: Create a GCN node classification template for Cora and explain how to run it.
output: GCN template generated for Cora node classification
Steps listed for installing PyG and running the script
Notes on dataset download location and expected accuracy output

best_practices: Start with small datasets before scaling to large graphs
Set random seeds when comparing benchmark results
Use validation accuracy to select best checkpoints
anti_patterns: Running benchmarks on huge datasets without setting limits
Assuming templates include custom data preprocessing
Visualizing full graphs without using max_nodes

faq.question: Which Python versions are supported?
faq.answer: It follows PyTorch Geometric compatibility, so use the versions recommended by PyG for your OS.

faq.question: What model types are included?
faq.answer: Templates include GCN, GAT, GraphSAGE for nodes and GIN for graphs, plus benchmarking and visualization tools.

faq.question: Can it integrate with my training pipeline?
faq.answer: Yes, you can adapt the generated templates and benchmarking code into your existing training scripts.

faq.question: Does it access my private data?
faq.answer: No, the code does not read sensitive files or send data over the network.

faq.question: What if dataset loading fails?
faq.answer: Check dataset names, PyG installation, and internet access for dataset downloads.

faq.question: How does it compare to a full MLOps stack?
faq.answer: It provides templates and scripts, not experiment tracking, deployment, or automated tuning.
